verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the sixth year, in the sixth month, in the fifth day of the month, as I sat in mine house, and the elders of Judah sat before me, that the hand of the Lord GOD fell there upon me.
verses.ct: In the 6th year, on the 5th day of the 6th month, I was sitting in my house with the elders of Judah sitting in front of me, when the power of the Lord GOD came over me.

verses.kjv: Then I beheld, and lo a likeness as the appearance of fire: from the appearance of his loins even downward, fire; and from his loins even upward, as the appearance of brightness, as the colour of amber.
verses.ct: I looked and saw a figure that appeared like fire — from the waist down it was all fire, and from the waist up it glowed with a brilliant radiance, like the color of glowing metal.

verses.kjv: And he put forth the form of an hand, and took me by a lock of mine head; and the spirit lifted me up between the earth and the heaven, and brought me in the visions of God to Jerusalem, to the door of the inner gate that looketh toward the north; where was the seat of the image of jealousy, which provoketh to jealousy.
verses.ct: He stretched out what looked like a hand and grabbed me by a lock of my hair. The spirit lifted me up between the earth and the heavens and carried me in visions from God to Jerusalem, to the entrance of the inner gate facing north. That was where the idol that provokes jealousy had been set up.

verses.kjv: And, behold, the glory of the God of Israel was there, according to the vision that I saw in the plain.
verses.ct: And the glory of the God of Israel was there, just as I had seen it in my vision on the plain.

verses.kjv: Then said he unto me, Son of man, lift up thine eyes now the way toward the north. So I lifted up mine eyes the way toward the north, and behold northward at the gate of the altar this image of jealousy in the entry.
verses.ct: He said to me, "Son of man, look toward the north." So I looked toward the north, and there at the entrance north of the altar gate stood this idol that provokes jealousy.

verses.kjv: He said furthermore unto me, Son of man, seest thou what they do? even the great abominations that the house of Israel committeth here, that I should go far off from my sanctuary? but turn thee yet again, and thou shalt see greater abominations.
verses.ct: Then he said to me, "Son of man, do you see what they are doing? The people of Israel are committing terrible, disgusting acts right here, driving me far from my sanctuary. But keep watching — you will see even worse things."

verses.kjv: And he brought me to the door of the court; and when I looked, behold a hole in the wall.
verses.ct: He brought me to the entrance of the courtyard, and when I looked, I saw a hole in the wall.

verses.kjv: Then said he unto me, Son of man, dig now in the wall: and when I had digged in the wall, behold a door.
verses.ct: He said to me, "Son of man, dig into the wall." So I dug into the wall, and I found a doorway.

verses.kjv: And he said unto me, Go in, and behold the wicked abominations that they do here.
verses.ct: He told me, "Go inside and see the horrible, disgusting things they are doing in there."

verses.kjv: So I went in and saw; and behold every form of creeping things, and abominable beasts, and all the idols of the house of Israel, pourtrayed upon the wall round about.
verses.ct: So I went in and looked around, and carved all over the walls were images of every kind of crawling creature and repulsive animal, along with all the idols of the people of Israel.

verses.kjv: And there stood before them seventy men of the ancients of the house of Israel, and in the midst of them stood Jaazaniah the son of Shaphan, with every man his censer in his hand; and a thick cloud of incense went up.
verses.ct: Standing in front of these images were 70 elders of the people of Israel, with Jaazaniah son of Shaphan among them. Each man held an incense burner in his hand, and a thick cloud of incense rose up.

verses.kjv: Then said he unto me, Son of man, hast thou seen what the ancients of the house of Israel do in the dark, every man in the chambers of his imagery? for they say, The LORD seeth us not; the LORD hath forsaken the earth.
verses.ct: He said to me, "Son of man, have you seen what the elders of the people of Israel are doing in the darkness, each one in his own room full of carved images? They tell themselves, 'The LORD doesn't see us. The LORD has abandoned this land.'"

verses.kjv: He said also unto me, Turn thee yet again, and thou shalt see greater abominations that they do.
verses.ct: Then he said to me, "Keep watching — you will see them doing even worse things."

verses.kjv: Then he brought me to the door of the gate of the LORD’s house which was toward the north; and, behold, there sat women weeping for Tammuz.
verses.ct: He brought me to the entrance of the north gate of the LORD's house, and there sat women weeping for the god Tammuz.

verses.kjv: Then said he unto me, Hast thou seen this, O son of man? turn thee yet again, and thou shalt see greater abominations than these.
verses.ct: He said to me, "Do you see this, son of man? Keep watching — you will see things even more disgusting than this."

verses.kjv: And he brought me into the inner court of the LORD’s house, and, behold, at the door of the temple of the LORD, between the porch and the altar, were about five and twenty men, with their backs toward the temple of the LORD, and their faces toward the east; and they worshipped the sun toward the east.
verses.ct: Then he brought me into the inner courtyard of the LORD's house. Right there at the entrance to the LORD's temple, between the porch and the altar, about 25 men stood with their backs turned to the LORD's temple and their faces toward the east, bowing down in worship to the sun.

verses.kjv: Then he said unto me, Hast thou seen this, O son of man? Is it a light thing to the house of Judah that they commit the abominations which they commit here? for they have filled the land with violence, and have returned to provoke me to anger: and, lo, they put the branch to their nose.
verses.ct: He said to me, "Do you see this, son of man? Is it not enough for the people of Judah to commit these disgusting acts here? They have also filled the land with violence and continue to provoke my anger. Look — they are even holding branches up to their noses in worship."

verses.kjv: Therefore will I also deal in fury: mine eye shall not spare, neither will I have pity: and though they cry in mine ears with a loud voice, yet will I not hear them.
verses.ct: "So I will respond with fury. I will show no mercy and have no pity. Even if they shout to me at the top of their lungs, I will not listen to them."
